metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Node.js File System Module
Node.js as a File Server
The Node.js file system module allows you to work with the file system on your computer.
content.html: The Node.js file system module allows you to work with the file system on your computer.

content.text: To include the File System module, use the require() method:
content.html: To include the File System module, use the require() method:

content.code_html: var fs = require('fs');

content.text: Common use for the File System module:
content.html: Common use for the File System module:

content.text: Read Files
The fs.readFile() method is used to read files on your computer.
content.html: The fs.readFile() method is used to read files on your computer.

content.text: Assume we have the following HTML file (located in the same folder as Node.js):
content.html: Assume we have the following HTML file (located in the same folder as Node.js):

content.code_html:
<html>
<body>
<h1>My Header</h1>
<p>My paragraph.</p>
</body>
</html>

content.text: Create a Node.js file that reads the HTML file, and return the content:
content.html: Create a Node.js file that reads the HTML file, and return the content:

content.code_html:
var http = require('http');
var fs = require('fs');
http.createServer(function (req, res) {
  fs.readFile('demofile1.html', function(err, data) {
    res.writeHead(200, {'Content-Type': 'text/html'});
    res.write(data);
    return res.end();
  });
}).listen(8080);

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_readfile.js", and initiate the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_readfile.js", and initiate the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_readfile.js

content.text: If you have followed the same steps on your computer, you will see the same result as the example: http://localhost:8080
content.html: If you have followed the same steps on your computer, you will see the same result as the example: http://localhost:8080

content.text: Create Files
The File System module has methods for creating new files:
content.html: The File System module has methods for creating new files:

content.text: The fs.appendFile() method appends specified content to a file. If the file does not exist, the file will be created:
content.html: The fs.appendFile() method appends specified content to a file. If the file does not exist, the file will be created:

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.appendFile('mynewfile1.txt', 'Hello content!', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('Saved!');
});

content.text: The fs.open() method takes a "flag" as the second argument, if the flag is "w" for "writing", the specified file is opened for writing. If the file does not exist, an empty file is created:
content.html: The fs.open() method takes a "flag" as the second argument, if the flag is "w" for "writing", the specified file is opened for writing. If the file does not exist, an empty file is created:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.open('mynewfile2.txt', 'w', function (err, 
  file) {  if (err) throw err;  console.log('Saved!');});

content.code:
var fs = require('fs');fs.open('mynewfile2.txt', 'w', function (err,
file) {  if (err) throw err;  console.log('Saved!');});

syntax_highlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.open('mynewfile2.txt', 'w', function (err, 
  file) {  if (err) throw err;  console.log('Saved!');});

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.open('mynewfile2.txt', 'w', function (err, file) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('Saved!');
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.open('mynewfile2.txt', 'w', function (err, 
  file) {  if (err) throw err;  console.log('Saved!');});

content.text: The fs.writeFile() method replaces the specified file and content if it exists. If the file does not exist, a new file, containing the specified content, will be created:
content.html: The fs.writeFile() method replaces the specified file and content if it exists. If the file does not exist, a new file, containing the specified content, will be created:

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'Hello content!', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('Saved!');
});

content.text: Update Files
The File System module has methods for updating files:
content.html: The File System module has methods for updating files:

content.text: The fs.appendFile() method appends the specified content at the end of the specified file:
content.html: The fs.appendFile() method appends the specified content at the end of the specified file:

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.appendFile('mynewfile1.txt', ' This is my text.', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('Updated!');
});

content.text: The fs.writeFile() method replaces the specified file and content:
content.html: The fs.writeFile() method replaces the specified file and content:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'This is my text', function (err) {  if (err) throw err;  
  console.log('Replaced!');});

content.code:
var fs = require('fs');fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'This is my text', function (err) {  if (err) throw err;
console.log('Replaced!');});

syntax_highlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'This is my text', function (err) {  if (err) throw err;  
  console.log('Replaced!');});

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'This is my text', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('Replaced!');
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.writeFile('mynewfile3.txt', 'This is my text', function (err) {  if (err) throw err;  
  console.log('Replaced!');});

content.text: Delete Files
To delete a file with the File System module, use the fs.unlink() method.
content.html: To delete a file with the File System module,  use the fs.unlink() method.

content.text: The fs.unlink() method deletes the specified file:
content.html: The fs.unlink() method deletes the specified file:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.unlink('mynewfile2.txt', function (err) {  
  if (err) throw err;  console.log('File deleted!');});

content.code:
var fs = require('fs');fs.unlink('mynewfile2.txt', function (err) {
if (err) throw err;  console.log('File deleted!');});

syntax_highlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.unlink('mynewfile2.txt', function (err) {  
 if (err) throw err;  console.log('File deleted!');});

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.unlink('mynewfile2.txt', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('File deleted!');
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.unlink('mynewfile2.txt', function (err) {  
  if (err) throw err;  console.log('File deleted!');});

content.text: Rename Files
To rename a file with the File System module, use the fs.rename() method.
content.html: To rename a file with the File System module,  use the fs.rename() method.

content.text: The fs.rename() method renames the specified file:
content.html: The fs.rename() method renames the specified file:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.rename('mynewfile1.txt', 'myrenamedfile.txt', function (err) {  
  if (err) throw err;  console.log('File Renamed!');});

content.code:
var fs = require('fs');fs.rename('mynewfile1.txt', 'myrenamedfile.txt', function (err) {
if (err) throw err;  console.log('File Renamed!');});

syntax_highlighting.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.rename('mynewfile1.txt', 'myrenamedfile.txt', function (err) {  
 if (err) throw err;  console.log('File Renamed!');});

content.code_html:
var fs = require('fs');

fs.rename('mynewfile1.txt', 'myrenamedfile.txt', function (err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log('File Renamed!');
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var fs = require('fs');fs.rename('mynewfile1.txt', 'myrenamedfile.txt', function (err) {  
  if (err) throw err;  console.log('File Renamed!');});

content.text: Upload Files
You can also use Node.js to upload files to your computer.
content.html: You can also use Node.js to upload files to your computer.

content.text: Read how in our Node.js Upload Files chapter.
content.html: Read how in our Node.js Upload Files chapter.
